meanings.definition: The highest part of a ship's mast.
meanings.sent1: The maintop of the ship swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The sailor climbed to the maintop to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagull landed on the maintop and pretended to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: From the maintop, the world below looked like a miniature village.
meanings.sent5: The maintop creaked as the wind picked up, signaling an approaching storm.

meanings.sent1: The maintop of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The maintop of the tree provided a perfect spot for the bird's nest.
meanings.sent3: The cat reached the maintop of the bookshelf and knocked down a vase.
meanings.sent4: The maintop of the building gleamed in the sunlight, visible from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The maintop of the tower offered a breathtaking view of the city below.

meanings.definition: A hairstyle where the hair is gathered and styled on top of the head.
meanings.sent1: She styled her hair in an elegant maintop for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The actress wore a beautiful maintop adorned with flowers.
meanings.sent3: His maintop was so tall that it almost touched the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: The maintop hairstyle was popular among the fashion-forward crowd.
meanings.sent5: The maintop hairstyle required a lot of pins to keep it in place.
